fields.description: The actual watchlist is not exportable (to excel e.g.). It should be possible to operate on watchlists like like on reports created by the Issue Navigator. Alternatively this improvement could be made by adding criteria fields to the Issue Navigator to select watched issues.

fields.description:
Something contained within the attached issue (in XML format) causes all HTML after the 'solutions' textarea/field to be rendered within the 'solutions' textarea.
This makes it impossible to change the security level or assignee of the issue.
fields.summary: Custom field textarea contents not escaped on edit page

fields.description: Helpful if the version workload report displayed the selected project in the title or description of the report.

fields.description:

Should work as other reports and portlets if a required configurable element is not available.

On the Project Browse page the tab panels should not disappear if a field is hidden, instead is should be greyed out with a cause

fields.summary: Polish language for JIRA

fields.description:
Currently we don't use oscache in JIRA anymore.  We should remove it from project.xml.

From what I can tell, we also need to:

- Find and remove all usages of CacheUtils.flush() and CacheUtils.flushAll()
- Remove oscache.tld
- Remove oscache.properties

Also, in core - we should check what else uses oscache, and remove them also.  Then remove the dependency from oscore, and rev it.
fields.summary: Remove oscache

fields.description: Currently we get emails from people who don't know that the calendar format can't be changed.  If we display that it can't be changed, then people will stop complaining :)
fields.summary: Display date picker format on look and feel page

fields.description:
reproduce:
create custom field type cascading drop down
add two parent values, two (or more) child values per parent
add new custom field to issue navigator
new field does not allow sorting in issue navigator - column 'bar' does not 'light up' (no mouse-over event), column heading is not html-link enabled, cannot click on column heading to 'sort' navigator rows.
fields.summary: Unable to sort on cascading drop down field

fields.description:
We just migrated to JIRA 3.0.2 on Oracle.
There is a problem on the workflow : JIRA cannot import XML File sizes greater than 4000 characters.
It's due to the oracle mapping that is made on VARCHAR2(4000).

Consequently, we cannot import the XML workflows we have defined.

Do you have a quick solution for this problem ?
fields.summary: Workflow size limited to 4000 characters in Oracle

fields.description:
I cannot create an attachment from a 0 byte file.

Some of our users run batch files which ftp 0 byte .ctl files to UNIX to start jobs.  In the event that there is a problem with the batch file, the user can create an issue in JIRA, but cannot attach the 0 byte .ctl file.  We would need to have this file to test/fix the batch file.
fields.summary: Attachment cannot be 0 bytes

fields.description: When moving an issue to another project, on the confirmation step it refreshes and stays at step 3. There is no error report but stepping ahead is failed
fields.summary: Cannot move the issue to another project

fields.description:
Note: The 'Project Information' panel is not available. 

When we go to the Browse Project page we do not get the Project Panel. The Project Panel plugin is installed and enabled. Is there a setting to display this?
fields.summary: Note: The 'Project Information' panel is not available.

fields.description:
Cannot authenticate user in Lotus Domino server even LDAP browsers can (parameters validity checked).

LDAP Configurator states: 
"Initial connect and search successful, but second phase connection to LDAP as '<cut-off>' failed (error: javax.naming.CommunicationException: Request: 4 cancelled; remaining name '<cut-off>'. More in logs)"

Logs states:
2004-11-19 14:33:57,662 INFO [web.action.util.LDAPConfigurer] javax.naming.Commu
nicationException: Request: 4 cancelled; remaining name '<cut-off>'
javax.naming.CommunicationException: Request: 4 cancelled; remaining name '<cut-off>'
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapRequest.getReplyBer(LdapRequest.java:60)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.readReply(Connection.java:405)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.ldapBind(LdapClient.java:340)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.authenticate(LdapClient.java:193)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.connect(LdapCtx.java:2640)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.ensureOpen(LdapCtx.java:2549)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.ensureOpen(LdapCtx.java:2523)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.compare(LdapCtx.java:2075)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.searchAux(LdapCtx.java:1804)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.c_search(LdapCtx.java:1734)
        at com.sun.jndi.toolkit.ctx.ComponentDirContext.p_search(ComponentDirCon
text.java:368)
...

This is known Domino problem - two phase LDAP querying requires reconnecion (see: https://list.unm.edu/cgi-bin/wa?A2=ind0311&L=jasig-portal&F=&S=&P=21622)

LDAP libraries could be LDAP-vendor sensible, provided third party library license allows it.
fields.summary: LDAP authentication fails for Lotus Domino

How can i change the sender mail addres to a global mail address when updating, commenting creating issues. At jira 2.6 Pro, All notification mail come from a global mail adress. However, now the mail address seem to come from the commenter. 

For example;

at Jira Pro 2.6

Oksijen_Support <oksijen_Support@oksijen.com>


at Jira Ent. 3.0.2

Halil Demirezen (JIRA) <oksijen_Support@oksijen.com>

I want to change "Halil Demirezen (JIRA)" to "Oksijen Support"

Although there is "Watch it" for the current user to watch the issue, there is no way that let the leader of the project assign a watcher. This feature is so strongly needed by us.

fields.summary: Error with SingleLevelGroupByReport if there are no saved filters

fields.description:
Currently JIRA's email templates are pretty ugly and hard to customise, because we pass in GenericValues to represent things like issues, versions and components. GVs are basically hashmaps.  If, say, you want to know the fix-for versions for an issue, there is no getVersions() method - you need to get an IssueManager and call issueManager.getEntitiesByIssue(IssueRelationConstants.FIX_VERSION, issue).

We avoid some of the pain by pre-evaluating certain relations in IssueMailQueueItem, which populates velocity variables like 'fixfors', 'versions', 'components' etc, but this also adds to the confusion - when is a variable predefined in the velocity context, and when must you write code to extract it?

Also, since you need various Managers to resolve relations, you're in trouble if that Manager wasn't passed to you through the context.  See for example filtersubscription.vm, which isn't passed an issueManager, and so cannot print details of related entities (versions etc) for the issue.

To solve this, we should define an object model for JIRA (something most products have from day one, but better late than never), with Issue, Component and Version objects, and simple methods like Issue.getVersions.  The interface between JIRA and the velocity template writer will then be very simple - just pass in an issue, or a list of issues.
fields.summary: Well-defined object-based data model for Velocity templates

fields.description:
Certain mail clients, notably MS Outlook, do not indent the replied-to message with >'s, but instead just append it after a separator:

-----Original Message----- 

We should enhance the NonQuotedCommentHandler to deal with this, and ignore contents after this separator.
fields.summary: Non-Quoted comment handler doesn't understand Outlook's '-----Original Message----- ' separator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5276].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have possibility to define default issue security level for each user/group.

This could be helpful in situation when customer (one group) creates issues with normal security level and 'internal' developers (other group) create issues within 'private' scope. 
Current model requires from developers manual setting 'private' security to hide issues from customer -- it is at least annoying.

This is extension to current issue security model so it is relatively simple to implement :)
fields.summary: Allow default issue security level at user/users-group level

fields.description:
When I'm creating a sub task for issue TWA-5551, and then I click cancel, it redirects me to https://hostname.com/jira/browse/TWA-5551%20  (Note that it appended a %20 on the end.)  This results in an error: 

PROJECT DOES NOT EXIST

ERROR
The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.
If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions.

fields.description:
When entering a new issue, and when filtering on issues, we do not see a "Due date" field.  Yesterday, it was there.  And, I did not change anything with regards to permissions.  But, I double-checked and see that I am assigned to a group "JIRA-devlopers" that has permission to "Schedule Issues" in the Default Permission Scheme, which we are using for all projects.

Yesterday, between when it was working and now, I added a new workflow for a new project, and changed some other settings like allowing unassigned users, and voting and watchers, etc..  But, I didn't change anything related to issue tracking.  So, I'm perplexed.

Please help.
fields.summary: Issue tracking not available

fields.description:

I would like all integrity checks to be green as I havn't done anything that should be wrong.

I tried to change a due date of a milestone or an issue.
If I set it in november it works, otherwise it doesn't.

fields.description:
I'd love to see the 'Choose Issue Type' step of the 'Create new issue' process skipped if there is only one issue type.  This is mainly for the "create sub task" workflow, but would apply to the "create new issue" workflow.

The default for new installs of JIRA 3.0+ is to have one subtask issue type, 'Sub-Task'.  For us, and for most users I suspect, this one issue type is fine.  However, it's a minor annoyance to have to click the 'create issue' button on the 'choose issue type' screen when there's only that one type.
fields.summary: automatically skip "Choose Issue Type" screen if only one issue type

User Timezone  	Europe/Berlin

The same offset is present in all times displayed.

fields.description:
We are planning on hosting a large number of projects on our Jira instance.

These projects will often require different issue types, priorities, resolutions and statuses.

I think it therefore makes sense to make an "issue settings scheme" concept just like permission schemes, workflows etc.

Unless I am missing something and this is already possible?
fields.summary: Allow Issue Settings to be project specific

fields.description:
Please include support for JDK1.5 in upcoming releases.
I did a short test using JDK1.5 which mostly worked, but I refrained from using it because os some problems that appeared. (As it is still called "unsupported" I quickly gave up so there is nothing I can report)

Reason: We would like to make use of the "better" GC support (pause tmes etc) on SMP machines.
fields.summary: 'Support' for JDK 1.5

fields.description:
General observation: Since the 3.0 upgrade, JIRA consumes _a lot of_ memory. It is therefore sometimes pretty slow.

I order to reduce memory usage, I ve decreased the issue cache capacity. It is now set to 500.
However I've just looked into the stats and it shows a "current cache size" of 2102. How can this happen?
Can JIRA effectivly work with cach sizes < max result set sizes?
fields.summary: Cache size > cache capacity?

fields.description:
JIRA entity model contains relations that result in generation of foreign keys that reference non-unique, non-primarykey fields. This is against the foreign key semantics and is not allowed at least in Oracle database. After fixing all the relations to have a unique name, there were 11 relations for which foreign keys couldn't be created.

For example: 
    <entity entity-name="Status" table-name="issuestatus" package-name="">
...
        <relation type="one" title="Child" rel-entity-name="Issue">
            <key-map field-name="id" rel-field-name="status"/>
        </relation>
    </entity>

This relation results in the following fk-clause (with fk-name set as 'status_childissue_fk'):
ALTER TABLE issuestatus ADD CONSTRAINT Status_ChildIssue_fk FOREIGN KEY (ID) REFERENCES jiraissue (issuestatus) INITIALLY DEFERRED

I can't see any logic in that relation. Status does not have a childissue. There should be a relation the other way though, to ensure referential integrity of issue status. This would result in something like:
ALTER TABLE jiraissue ADD CONSTRAINT ISSUE_STATUS_FK FOREIGN KEY (issuestatus) REFERENCES issuestatus (id) INITIALLY DEFERRED
fields.summary: Mapping errors in entitymodel relations
Automatic creation of foreign keys and indices fails on Oracle database

fields.description:
when a large number of custom fields are added to a project, the result can become quite unweildy. it would be very beneficial to users if fields could be grouped together and displayed in one or more tabs.

this also applies to editing, though one might opt for a more wizard-style approach (since having multiple tabs for entering data on a website is always a bit ugly to implement)
fields.summary: improve field layouts: group fields in tabs

fields.description:
- While not logged in to Jira, navigate to http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssue.jspa
- You will be presented with a screen to logon
- Logon and you will see the following exception on the create issue screen
Form Errors:
An exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Generic Value cannot be null..

This seems to be caused because the user is redirected to the same form they tried to use without being logged in, and the info sent to the form has not been updated with their login session.

Simply clicking on 'Create New Issue' removes the form exception
fields.summary: create new issue exception - generic value can not be null

Works fine for the geeks, but the end user is less interested and more intimidated by large urls.  A possible solution is to creat tinyurl'esqe links that are easier to throw around.

fields.description:
An issue summary containing tags show ok within the issue.
It shows not ok within the
"Open Issues: Assigned To Me   (Displaying 15 of 15)" list.

Example for summary:
     <tag>: any task to do

The <> sign show up in the resulting HTML literally.
Instead they should be encoded as "<" and ">".
This is not valid HTML and confuses browsers.
fields.summary: <tag>: Not displayed correctly

fields.description: Allow JIRA to function as an LDAP server so It can be used to authenticate an entire intranet.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to function as an LDAP server

fields.description:
Is there any way to customize the Issue status workflow, perhaps by adding more Issue States (statuses)?  I would like to isolate each state of Issues and assign control the permissions by means of roles (groups).
For instance, we would like the following sequences:

Submitted: From Support Team
Open: Project Manager opens issue and assigns to developer
Accepted: Developer accepts
Dev In Progress: Developer working on issue
Rejected by Developer: Developer rejects as issue
Fixed: Developer resolves
QA Ready: Issue is pending validation from QA
QA In Progress: QA working on issue
Rejected by QA: QA rejects developer's resolution
Closed As Fixed: Issue resolved and closed
Closed As Rejected: Issue closed - not valid issue

I realize that some of these states are provided, but wish to enforce a more rigid workflow.  Is there any way to customize the Issue and Statuses and/or the Permission Schemes?
fields.summary: CLONE -Customizing the Issue Status Workflow

fields.description:
If a user comments on an issue, and that user is later deleted, the comment is displayed with an unevaluated velocity expression:

 Comment by $action.user.fullName
fields.summary: Deleting a user breaks their comments

fields.description:
If I try to import a JIRA XML backup that is invalid (because it contains a control characters), the import fails with the message:

Failed to import data: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport@b2c64, result: error Exception occurred: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: -1, Size: 0

and stacktrace:

2004-11-17 16:36:12,743 ERROR [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Exception occurred: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: -1, Size: 0
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: -1, Size: 0
    at java.util.LinkedList.entry(LinkedList.java:360)
    at java.util.LinkedList.get(LinkedList.java:303)
    at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.processException(DataImport.java:199)
    at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.doExecute(DataImport.java:91)
    at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:151)
    at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:46)

As the stacktrace suggests, the error has nothing to do with the invalid character, but is actually a bug in JIRA's error handling code.
fields.summary: Importing invalid XML prints irrelevant error

fields.description:
Our enterprise email servers only accept SSL connections, so I'm unable to create issues via email b/c the Imap service barfs when trying to make an insecure connection.  Will SSL IMAP support be added in the future?  Is there a way I can dig into the code (eg subclassing an existing class) and provide my own SSL Imap service?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Enable Issue creation from a SSL Imap or Pop account

fields.description:
I have an issue with summary 

"add fork/spawn to <clover-view> task"

In the Road Map view this renders as

"add fork/spawn to task"

because the < and > aren't being escaped.

The same is true for the Change Log view.


I had a quick search around but couldn't find a bug that covered this, so I'm raising a new one.
fields.summary: < and > not escaped in issue summaries for Change Log, Road Map view

fields.description:
The XSLT used for limiting length of long String data to 4000 (for Oracle) attached to this issue:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2152#action_17196
does not pick up all the long strings.

The pobably cause is that it does not "look" at all "long-varchar" fields mentioned in the entitymodel.xml file.
fields.summary: The XSLT for long string limitation does not look through all fields

fields.description: It would be a great benefit if one could select a set of custom fields to be displayed on the "resolve" page.  For instance, a "Build # XXXXX"
fields.summary: Custom filed on the "resolve" form

fields.description:
Outlook seems to include the contents of the original e-mail after the:

-----Original Message----- 

line, rather than use ">" characters to quote it.

Need to handle this properly.
fields.summary: Improve CreateIssueHandler to handle Outlook messages

fields.description:
When I search for the term "for production:" in the Quick Search field, I get the following exception:

Issue Navigator 
Errors: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
 
The Issue Navigator allows you to browse all the issues in the system. Filters allow you to limit the issues that you see. 

Using the panel on the left, you can create and edit new filters. 

ERRORS: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
fields.summary: Putting a : after a search term in Quick Search does not work

fields.description:
One of our users brought this up today.  When you resolve an issue, the text at the top of the page says "If you have permission to close issues, you can optionally resolve & close the issue at the same time.", similar to what he saw in 2.6.  

Let us know how this inconsistency will be resolved...(I vote remove the text, since close issue does the same thing as "resolve and close" did in 2.6).
fields.summary: Resolve & Close functionality removed?

fields.description:
When an issue is viewed from the 'Time Tracking Report' (by clicking on an issue key link in the report), a 'Return to search' link appears on the issue details screen (see attachment).  Clicking on the 'Return to search' link takes the user to the 'Find Issues' screen, but not back to the 'Time Tracking Report' as one would expect.

The 'Return to search' link only appears if the user currently has a search configured in the 'Find Issues' screen.


Steps to replicate:
 1. From the 'Find Issues' screen start a search for issues on a particular project
 2. Go to the 'Time Tracking Report' for a different project
 3. Click on an issue link in the 'Time Tracking Report' to view an issue
 4. Notice the 'Return to search' link on the top right - clicking it will take you to the search screen for a different project.


This behaviour can be confusing - one would expect the 'Return to search' link to return the user to the 'Time Tracking Report' in the case that the user navigated to the issue from there.

Regards,
Andrew.
fields.summary: "Return to search" appears when viewing issue from "Time Tracking Report"

fields.description: In the Personal Roadmap, no differentiation is made between tasks and subtasks, while in Global the super task is shown above the sub.
fields.summary: Personal Roadmap does not show subtasks in same manner as Global Roadmap

fields.description: Find issues -> select project -> uncheck/unselect every option but summary search and enter "-merge" (no quotes) to find every issue that does not have the word merge in it returns no issues (there should be many).
fields.summary: search filter "-" does not work when used alone.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5231].
  {panel}

Time tracking is not granular enough.

While it is fine to enable/disable time tracking at the server level the details need to be configurable at the project level.

We would like to be able to configure number of working hours per day and number of days per week at the project level.

Ideally, these should be overridable in a given user's profile (so that for example, you could assign a different number of hours per day to a very junior developer to reflect lower productivity).
fields.summary: Time tracking should take account of employee working hours and utilisation
Create date on Jellytags: "AssignIssue" and "TransitionWorkflow"

fields.description:
We have a very large user base (thousands of users).

It would be good if a group could contain a reference to other groups since this makes maintaining groups much less tedious.

For example:

Group A: User1, User2

Group B: User65, User 98

Group C: Group A, Group B, User 142

Group C is in a sense "dyanmic" so that if another user is added to Group A then Group C is effectively updated too (i.e. I'm not request the ability to have a "one time copy" of users into a new group).
fields.summary: Groups should be able to contain other groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5228].
  {panel}

I have a customised Jira/Confluence installation.

In our installation, we do not want to have a central administrator. Therefore we allow any user to create:

* groups of users (users are authenticated using LDAP and I have arranged that user profiles are created upon authentication if they do not exist so no need to create user accounts manually)
* projects
* permission schemes
* notification schemes
* workflows

etc. etc.

It would be ideal if all these entities had ACLs associated with them. In particular user groups really should not be modifiable by anyone - if we protect content in Confluence by granting permission to a particular group, we really don't want people to be able to view the content by going in and temporarily adding themselves to the appropriate group.

The ACLs should allow specification of users and groups for read, update and delete operations.
fields.summary: Introduce access control lists
Rule-based / pluggable permission types
Encrypt mail passwords in JIRA database

fields.description:
*Original request description:*
 
As JIRA user who creates issues and subtasks I want this process to be as easy as possible. Therefore I want the subtasks to assume the values of fields from the parent issue, so that I do not have to enter these values manually. But at the same time I want to be provided with a choice of the fields which will be used for propagation, because clearing redundant fields is going to also cost me some time. Among the propagated fields the following should be allowed for selection as a minimum: affected version, fix version, components and optionally: severity and labels.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should inherit selectable fields from the parent task

fields.description: As reported by users of the Perforce plugin, JiraKeyUtils isn't correctly identifying issue keys when they're surrounded by [] - ie [JRA-107].
fields.summary: Issue key regex is broken with punctuation

fields.description: When trying to move an issue we click on the Next Button on Step 2 and it just returns to itself, it does not progress.
fields.summary: Unable to Move issues

fields.description:
Currently we can create a Custom Field as Global, Issue Type or Project.

The problem I'm having is I have a Custom Field that I would like on multiple Projects.  When I choose project it only lets me associate it with one project.  And then i can't create multiple Custom Fields with the same Field name to associate them with different projects.

It would be nice if we could assign a Custom Field to multiple project and not Global.
fields.summary: Custom Fields with multiple (but not all) Projects

fields.description:
According to the docs, when setting up an email service (I'm using IMAP and NonQuotedCommentHandler), if the address in the 'From:' header is a JIRA user, it'll use that user as the author of the comment. However, it always seems to use admin for me. I presume it knows to strip off the non-address portions of the 'From:' header, right?

I don't know if it matters, but I just noticed this in the logs:

2004-11-12 03:12:47,689 WARN [core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory] [JNDIFactory.getUserTransaction] Failed to find UserTransaction named java:comp/UserTransaction in JNDI.
2004-11-12 03:12:47,848 WARN [core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory] NamingException while finding UserTransaction named java:comp/UserTransaction in JNDI.
javax.naming.NamingException: Cannot create resource instance
        at org.apache.naming.factory.TransactionFactory.getObjectInstance(TransactionFactory.java:145)
        at javax.naming.spi.NamingManager.getObjectInstance(NamingManager.java:301)


Maybe I overlooked something particular with PostgreSQL setup.
fields.summary: From address not used?

fields.description:
Write a Tutorial for the JIRA Plugin Development Kit

So we can simply refer to this doco rather than repeat it every time we write a new tutorial
fields.summary: Write a Tutorial for the JIRA Plugin Development Kit

fields.description: There's no clear documentation of SOAP and the XML-RPC doco is a little out of date and need to be updated.
fields.summary: Document SOAP & Update XML-RPC documentation

fields.description:
Write tutorial for creating a SOAP client on confluence.

This will use Axis and be for RPC Plug-in version 1.3
fields.summary: Write tutorial for creating a SOAP client

fields.description:
The projects porlet has a bunch of links to filters.  If generating statistics does not have much performance hit, it might be useful to have totals for each filter:

			
Filter Issues:
- All (1035)
- Outstanding  (39)
- Unscheduled  (2)
- Assigned to me (5)
- Reported by me (69)
	- Resolved recently (0)
- Added recently (1)
- Updated recently (3)
- Most important
fields.summary: Add filter statistics to the projects portlet

fields.description: In certain odd circumstances, people find themselves with issue that have no status set (it is either NULL or a value not corresponding to a status).  We should add an integrity check to test for this.
fields.summary: Add an 'undefined status' workflow check

fields.description:
When linking an issue that doesn't exit, you get the error message:

The issue key {0} does not exist.
fields.summary: Error messgae not i18n'd for LinkExistingIssue

fields.description: The Project Statistics Portlet displays archived versions - even though it states it does not.
fields.summary: Project Statistics Portlet shows archived versions - even though it states it doesnt.

fields.description:
When trying to bulk edit issues if you do not alter any fields - but the assignee is set to 'Automatic' and will result in a different assignee than the current one - then you cannot progress past step 3.

The current assignee is not valid for the project - this resulted from an issue import/data migration.

Now the user needs to be removed and all their issues should be re-assigned to a new user. However this cannot be done via bulk edit.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit - change assignee to 'automatic' - stuck in step 3

fields.description: If you have a user w/o any filters created and you select the create filter option link that's part of the 'you have no filters - click me to create' message (not exact message - just trying to differentiate it from the 'create new filter' option that always appears) the 'find issues' page comes up with a predefined filter that returns several issues (and takes a long time to create).
fields.summary: Create New Filter option on Home page slow first time
Authenticator interface should support authenticating tokens

fields.description:
Is it possible to make a "reply" to a JIRA Auto-mail become a comment to the issue?
I have full access to the mail-server and can create any email accounts needed.
fields.summary: Replying to JIRA mails

fields.description:
Hello

I'm trying to import an XML backup from JIRA 2.5 to JIRA 3.0.2 Professional

I'm getting this error

"An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x13) was found in the CDATA section"

and the import fails. 

I tried to manually fix the XML data but it keeps finding those characters in other places (comments).

This may be related to JRA-4980, but I'm not sure.
fields.summary: Error "An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x__) was found in the CDATA section" when importing XML

fields.description: It would be nice if it was possible to see the previous comments and issue description on the add comment page. Often when making a comment one needs to on the same time to re-read other comments on the issue.
fields.summary: Show previous comments and issue description on add comment page

fields.description:
Try to search for "open AND more" from Quick Search box:
Search results for "AND more" are opened.
fields.summary: Particular words can be ignored in Quick Search box

fields.description:
On the 'Field Layout' screen, a 'greyed out' Required link is shown for the hidden Attachments field.

On selecting 'Show' - this option is not actually available - so it would be better to not display the Required link at all?
fields.summary: Field Layout - 'Greyed Out' Required link shown for hidden Attachments field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5202].
  {panel}

Currently in JIRA, an issue is deemed resolved (in reports, portlets etc) if it has a resolution set.  This includes both Resolved and Closed issues, and generally works fine.  However in JIRA 3, people can:

 - Have more than one issue deemed 'closed', but which may not yet have a resolution
 - Edit the 'resolve' transition (or equivalent) to not set the resolution

In these cases, the built-in assumption that resolution == closed breaks.  It would be better to just have a 'closed' flag on the issue.  This would also enable a number of new queries and statistics to be generated (ask Mike for details).
fields.summary: Need flag to mark status as 'closed'

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to specify more than one user as assignee or reporter when creating a filter. Also, there is no way to allow users to create groups to use 'filter groups' w/o giving them administrator privileges.

This has nothing to do with allowing an issue to be assigned to more than 1 developer (ref 1802). 

The use case here is a large development group with several team leaders managing several projects. Often developers working on the same component report to different managers - so managers cannot use a simple group to get a list of all the issues their developers are working on.

In this case the only way to resolve is to either 1) create a list of group names based on the manager name which contain developers who are currently reporting to them or 2) allow managers to create filters specifying multiple users in the assigned to and reported by filter fields.

Option #2 is superior as it reduces the work load of the supporting IT staff and reduces frustration of the SW managers who otherwise have to wait for IT to fullfill their requests and then wait for the system to be reindexed in order to use the filter.

As this is important to us I've tried to link it to every issue somewhat related.
fields.summary: Enable filter to specify more than 1 user

fields.description:
AxisHTTPSessionListener causes Logout to fail

The listener tries to remove life cycle objects from the session when the session has already been destroyed. This fails in Resin with the exception:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can't call getAttribute() when session is no longer valid.
fields.summary: AxisHTTPSessionListener causes Logout to fail in Resin

fields.description:
This seems to have been causing the following errors:

  http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=4943&tstart=225

  http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5832&tstart=450

If you see the call ProjectManager.getNextId() taking a long time, then that this is the problem.
fields.summary: Create Issue page slow with many projects

fields.description:
We have made some of the fields - due date and time estimate - required, which is not their default state.  Cloning an issue does not copy the data in these fields.  JIRA simply creates a new issue that is missing required data.  This is not noticed until someone eventually tries to edit the cloned issue.

Now, if there's some reason not to clone all the data when making a "clone", then could JIRA at least copy the required data?
fields.summary: Clone issue does not copy all required fields!

fields.description:
A user reports, "Intermittently we recieve an error when attempting to delete an attachment from an issue, or when deleting an issue
containing an attachment.  It seems to occur only when the attachment has a thumbnail image ('_thumb_' file) associated with
it, and when it is the only attachment for the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
 1. Create Issue
 2. Attach Screenshot
 3. Click on the issue key (so the thumbnail is created)
 4. Click on 'Manage Attachments' and attempt to delete the attachment.
 5. 'Could not delete attachment file' error appears (see attached image and log).

Sometimes the error appears and the attachment/issue is not deleted, and other times it works fine...

As a temporary workaround I have disabled thumbnails for the attachments.
"
